intro: Callicarpa japonica f. rugosior, commonly known as the roughleaf beautyberry, is a shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, bright purple berries that appear in late summer. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in the spring, which are typically pink or white. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its attractive foliage and berries. The fruit is edible for humans and wildlife, though it is typically consumed in small quantities.
